titleStmt.title: The fou[n]tayne or well of lyfe out of whiche doth springe most swete co[n]solatio[n]s, right necessary for troubled co[n]sciences, to then rent ye they shall nat despeyre in aduersite and trouble. Translated out of latyn in to Englysshe.
Bible. English. Selections.

The fou[n]tayne or well of lyfe out of whiche doth springe most swete co[n]solatio[n]s, right necessary for troubled co[n]sciences, to then rent ye they shall nat despeyre in aduersite and trouble. Translated out of latyn in to Englysshe.
Bible. English. Selections.

notesStmt.note: Place of publication and printer's name from colophon; publication date conjectured by STC.
Reproductions of the original in the Cambridge University Library.
Appears at reel 49:9 and at reel 230:7 (same copy filmed twice).
